data.title: Violet: Name Meaning, Origin, Popularity
data.meta_description: Violet is commonly used as a girl name. Learn more about the meaning, origin, and popularity of the name Violet.
data.text:
Violet is a lovely name that evokes the beauty, grace, and nature. It's an English name of Latin origin that means purple. It also represents violets and other purple flowers. Violet originates from the Latin viola, which means purple. Viola, of course, is also a name in its own right.

Violet is a vintage name that had its heyday in the early 20th century but regained popularity in the early 2000s. It combines the classic sound of an old-fashioned name with both a flower and color name. Despite its deep roots, Violet also exudes a fresh, modern vibe.

In many cultures, purple is a color of royalty. The name Violet connotes regality, leadership, strength, and grace. Violet's link to the violet flower also imbues this name with beauty, delicacy, and vibrancy.

How Popular Is the Name Violet?

Violet is an increasingly popular name that has been around for centuries. Violet's popularity has been particularly prominent in England, Ireland, and Scotland. According to the Social Security Administration, Violet enjoyed steady top 100 status in the first quarter of the 20th century before taking a nosedive from the 1950s to the early 2000s. The name plummeted to the 997th spot on the list in 1981.

Violet has experienced a resurgence, jumping from 734th in 2000 to the 369th position on the list just five years later. In 2012, Violet reached the top 100 and has stayed either there or above ever since. In 2015, the name became the 50th most popular, and by 2020, Violet was ranked as the 37th most used name. Violet was the 16th most popular name in 2023.

One reason this name's popularity has taken off is that celebrity parents, including Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck, have named their daughters Violet. Another key to Violet's growing appeal is that it resonates with popular trends that favor flower names, color names, and classic names.

Name Variations

There are multiple spelling variations for the name Violet, and the name is used in many languages, including English, Italian, French, Spanish, and Russian. Here are some other forms and spellings of the name Violet from around the world:

Viola (Latin)

Violeta (Spanish, Greek, Bulgarian)

Violetta (Italian, Russian)

Violette, Violett (French, English)

Wioleta (Polish)

Similar Names

If you are still not completely sold on the name Violet, you may want to consider other names that start with the letter "V". These include:

Vale

Valencia

Valentina

Valerie

Vanessa

Vanna

Vanya

Vera

Verna

Victoria

Vivien

For more classic names, here are a few to consider:

Betty

And, if flower or plant names are more your style, you might like these names:

Holly

Poppy

Rose

Common Nicknames for Violet

There are several common nicknames for Violet. These include:

Letta

Lettie/Letty

Lottie/Lotty

V

Vi

Vi-Vi

Vivie

Suggested Sibling Names

Looking for a sibling name for Violet? Some popular options include:

Benjamin

Brynn

Charlie

Edward

Evelyn

Hank

June

Lynn

Olivia

Noah

Salma

Silvia

Walter

Famous People Named Violet

The name Violet has been around for a long time, so your baby would be in good company with this name. There are plenty of notable historical and literary figures your baby would share a name with. Here are a few of the more famous Violets.

Famous Violets

Violet Aitken, British suffragette

Violet Astor, British aristocrat

Violet Barclay, American illustrator

Violet Barungi, Ugandan editor

Violet Blue, American author

Violet Brown, Jamaican supercentenarian

Violet Bonham Carter, British politician

Violet Brunton, English artist

Violet Cliff, British ice skater

Violet Fane, British poet

Violet Hackbarth, All-American Girls Professional Baseball League player

Violet Heming, English actress

Violet Hopkins, American painter

Violet La Plante, American silent film star

Violet MacMillan, American Broadway theater actress

Violet Oakley, American artist

Violet Palmer, American basketball referee

Violet Tweedale, Scottish poet
